clinical_study.brief_title: Preliminary Study of the Sagittal Alignment of the Lumbo-pelvic Complex in a Sitting Position
clinical_study.official_title: Preliminary Study of the Sagittal Alignment of the Lumbo-pelvic Complex in a Sitting Position

brief_summary.textblock: The main objective of this study is to investigate the influence of seat type (straight chair versus "ergonomic" chair) on the sagittal alignment of the lumbo-pelvic complex in two different postures compared to standing for each individual in both a chronic-back-pain and a non-chronic-back-pain population.

primary_outcome.measure: % variation in the pelvic incidence angle in sitting compared to standing

secondary_outcome.measure: % variation in the sacral slope angle in sitting compared to standing
% variation in the pelvic tilt angle in sitting compared to standing
% variation in the lumbar lardosis angle in sitting compared to standing

arm_group.description: This group of patients has had chronic back pain for longer than 3 months.

This group of patients is hospitalized for cardio physical therapy, and has no lumbar-pelvic complications. Patients are selected from the hospitalized population according to age, sex, and BMI in order to match chronic back pain patients.

intervention.description: 5 xrays will be taken: (1) Upright standing position; (2) Upright, straight chair position; (3) Slouching, straight chair position; (4) Upright, ergonomic chair position; (5) Slouching, ergonomic chair position.

study_pop.textblock: Two populations are compared: one with chronic back pain, and the other a group of hospitalized patients with no lombo-peliven complications.

criteria.textblock:
General Inclusion Criteria:
- The patient must have given his/her informed and signed consent
- The patient must be insured or beneficiary of a health insurance plan
Inclusion Criteria for the Chronic Back Pain Group
- Patient has chronic lombalgia (> 3 months)
- Patient has discopathy evidenced by standard imaging of the lumbar spine
Inclusion Criteria for the Non Chronic Back Pain Group
- Patient does not have chronic lombalgia or neurological symptoms
- Patients hospitalized for cardiovascular physical therapy which does not interfere with the sagital alignment of the lombo-pelivien complex (post-infarctus care, cardiac insufficiency)
Exclusion Criteria:
- The patient is participating in another study
- The patient is in an exclusion period determined by a previous study
- The patient is under judicial protection, under tutorship or curatorship
- The patient refuses to sign the consent
- It is impossible to correctly inform the patient
- The subject has had more than two x-rays, or similar ray exposure during the previous year
- The subject has a professional activity or hobby that exposes him/her to radiation
- The subject has a lombo-pelivien malformation
